programme.title: Reu & Harper's Wonder World
programme.desc: Exploring the cultures and customs of Poland

programme.title: Mimi's World
programme.desc: Letty learns how to be in charge and to work as part of a team

programme.title: Daisy & Ollie
programme.desc: The friends are amazed when they meet someone who lives in a camper van, so they explore different types of accommodation and consider what is it that makes somewhere a home

programme.title: The World According to Grandpa
programme.desc: A tall tale about why moles live underground

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Leonardo tires of being in charge and hands over leadership of the team to Raphael, before running into a female ninja who tempts him to turn evil

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross bumps into his ex-wife, while Chandler meets an old flame during a double date with Joey, and Rachel, Monica and Phoebe have a run-in with some firefighters

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica applies to become head chef in a fancy restaurant, but the owner proves to be so high on drugs he is unable to appreciate the food she prepares to impress him. Guest starring Melora Hardin (The Office: An American Workplace) and Jon Lovitz

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Part one of two. Phoebe feels neglected when she learns that Joey has fallen in love with her identical twin, while Chandler experiences trouble when he is asked to fire an attractive employee. Ross had last-minute doubts about becoming a parent. Guest starring Helen Hunt

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: A look at the life of songwriter Lee Duffy, who has worked as a musician in Benidorm for 15 years and is saving to record his own song hoping it might feature in a film or advert

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Jackie has built a successful chain of tattoo studios in Benalmadena. Now she plans to expand her portfolio by going into tea production - but not traditional tea

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura uses her pink scooter to get to and from gigs and tribute performances - and in the hope of getting noticed. Tracey and Neil Harvey test out their new sausages

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: Documentary following Noel and Sue Radford as they cope with their supersized family, as well as grandchildren, dogs, teenage parties and home-schooling. In the opening edition, Sue is about to give birth to their 22nd child just as the nation goes into lockdown and when the latest addition arrives home, everyone else in the house must muck in

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following Noel and Sue Radford as they cope with their supersized family, as well as grandchildren, dogs, teenage parties and home-schooling. 18-year-old Millie has a baby of her own, and 25-year-old Chloe is house hunting with her new boyfriend. Later, the whole extended brood come together for a joyful double christening to welcome Bonnie and Heidie, the newest members of this great big family

programme.title: Inside Legoland: A World of Wonder
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at one of the UK's most popular theme parks, including a profile of Paula who is in charge of the park's model workshop. And with scores of rooms to clean each day, Michele from housekeeping has some top tips on keeping Lego in tip-top condition

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: When the Spencers Met the Monarchy
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the impact of the marriage of Diana Spencer and Prince Charles on their respective families, shedding light on the dynamics behind the scenes throughout the union, with the clash between the Spencers and the Windsors among the most high-profile, acrimonious fall-outs in royal history

programme.title: Isle of Wight: Jewel of the South
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the breathtaking natural beauty and rich historical heritage of the Isle of Wight, by following the lives of residents whose families have lived there for generations. In Yarmouth, upmarket hotelier Howard Spooner prepares for one of the busiest weeks of the summer, while in Briddlesford, fourth generation farmer Paul Griffin is battling the summer drought. Cameras also follow Helen Butler on one of her regular forays into the island's verdant forests on her quest to save the 3,000 native red squirrels. In Ryde, entertainer Derek Sandy is preparing for his Love Monday entertainment night, which this week sees the final of his island-wide talent competition

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: The history of Hampton Court's Great Hall, a huge dining area built by more than 400 stonemasons, bricklayers, carpenters, joiners and labourers that was also used by Henry VIII to keep an eye on his household. Plus, a look at the 2002 Golden Jubilee Party, which was held in the grounds of Buckingham Palace and is considered to have changed the public's perception of monarchy

programme.title: Kate: Our New Diana?
programme.desc: Documentary comparing and contrasting the life and style of two Princesses of Wales. Diana, international icon and still one of the most famous people on earth, tragically died in 1997 and never met her daughter-in-law. However, when Kate took on Diana's title, she was often asked about following in Diana's footsteps

programme.title: Top of the Box
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly takes a look back at the most popular British TV programmes from a past year, beginning with 1985 and shows including 'Allo 'Allo!, Name that Tune and Crossroads, plus a famous interview with Prince Charles and Princess Diana on their fourth wedding anniversary - and a parody of it featuring the Spitting Image puppets. Featuring the last ever interview with Jim Bowen, host of Bullseye

programme.title: Sex & Power: Tabloids
programme.desc: Three-part series delving into the world of tabloid journalism, exploring the lengths the tabloids go to for a story, and the lives they have impacted in the process, featuring rarely seen archive footage and the voices of editors, journalists and celebrity contributors. The first edition focuses on the intertwined narratives of tabloid newspapers and celebrity culture, examining the tabloid's treatment of famous faces such as Ulrika Jonsson, Kerry Katona and Daniella Westbrook

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Red Arrows: Kings of the Sky
programme.desc: Two pilots from the famous squadron attempt a series of hair-raising manoeuvres for the first time as the team begin their intense winter training ahead of the RAF centenary celebrations. This episode also takes a look behind the breathtaking action, and follows the efforts of the ground teams as they practice, plan and prepare for the shows

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Peter Wright gets an emergency call from sheep farmer Clive, whose ewe has gone into labour, but the lambs are tangled up inside their mother. One arrives safely but the second isn't breathing, and Peter's skills are put to the test when he realises there is a third lamb still to come. In Boroughbridge, Julian and Anne operate on a dog with a tumour in its chest

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Interior design expert Ann Maurice visits Stepney in London's East End, where she advises part-time DJ Simon Denny on how to make his two-bedroom split-level converted brewery lodge more attractive to potential buyers

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet learns how sand is formed and Mark shows him how it can be used to make sculptures

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: An alien gives the pups a talking rock, but it gets trapped in a cave

programme.title: Texas Lady (1955)
programme.desc: A woman arrives in Texas to take over the local newspaper, and vows to use it to expose corruption. Her first target is the gambler she wrongly holds responsible for her father's suicide, but who proves an unlikely ally when she faces the real villains - two cattle barons who rule the town with an iron fist. Western, with Claudette Colbert, Barry Sullivan and Gregory Walcott

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog (1955)
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: Zulu (1964)
programme.desc: An upper-class soldier and his fellow officer stationed at Rorke's Drift in 1879 discover they have been cut off after the destruction of the main British army column in the area. They must rally their small force of 140 men against the might of 4,000 Zulu warriors advancing on their position. Fact-based historical drama, starring Michael Caine, Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, Nigel Green and Chief Buthelezi, with narration by Richard Burton

programme.title: Bride Wars (2009)
programme.desc: Two lifelong best friends discover their weddings have been scheduled on the same day and at the same venue. Neither is prepared to back down, so a bitter rivalry ensues as years of friendship are cast aside in the struggle to sabotage each other's big day. Comedy, starring Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway, Candice Bergen and Chris Pratt

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the spectacular seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation (2015)
programme.desc: The team of secret agents faces being shut down when the head of the CIA convinces the US Senate that it is too dangerous. The operatives of the Impossible Mission Force become fugitives when they defy orders and plot to bring down a shadowy society of assassins. Spy thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Rebecca Ferguson and Simon Pegg

programme.title: Happening (2021)
programme.desc: A woman reflects on her experiences of 1960s France, when abortion was still illegal. Drama based on Annie Ernaux's novel, starring Anamaria Vartolomei, Kacey Mottet Klein and Luana Bajrami star. In French

programme.title: Some Voices (2000)
programme.desc: A troubled but kind psychiatric patient is released into the care of his restaurateur brother, only to fall for a smart Scottish girl with problems of her own. Romantic drama, based on the stage play by Joe Penhall, starring Daniel Craig, Kelly Macdonald, Julie Graham and Peter McDonald

programme.title: Hatari! (1962)
programme.desc: A group of reckless animal trappers travels through the wilds of Africa, but the arrival of a beautiful photographer looks set to cause upheaval among the group. Comedy adventure, starring John Wayne, Red Buttons, Hardy Kruger, Elsa Martinelli and Michele Girardon

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)
programme.desc: A British colonel in a Japanese PoW camp is ordered to build a railway bridge over a river, forging a vital communications link. At first he refuses to obey, but eventually agrees to take the project on - and becomes so obsessed with the task that he creates a dilemma for an American soldier sent to destroy the structure. David Lean's Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek (1952)
programme.desc: A gambler goes after the gang of claim jumpers who killed his father, and joins forces with an injured marshal who also wants the criminals brought to justice. However, their partnership is tested when a devious femme fatale enters their lives. Don Siegel's Western, starring Audie Murphy, Stephen McNally and Faith Domergue

programme.title: Eye in the Sky (2015)
programme.desc: Colonel Katherine Powell's mission to wipe out a terrorist cell in Kenya is complicated when a girl enters the blast radius of the intended drone strike. Powell has to decide between sacrificing the girl's life or letting the terrorists flee to carry out more atrocities. Thriller, starring Helen Mirren, Alan Rickman and Aaron Paul

programme.title: The Departed (2006)
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin

programme.title: Significant Other (2022)
programme.desc: A young couple take a remote backpacking trip through the Pacific Northwest. However, things take a dark turn when they realise they might not be alone. Thriller, starring Maika Monroe and Jake Lacy

programme.title: We Summon the Darkness (2019)
programme.desc: One summer night in 1988, Alexis Butler and her friends Val and Bev head to a gig by the Soldiers of Satan. However, during the band's after-show party in Indiana, things take a deadly turn. Director Marc Meyers' horror thriller, starring Alexandra Daddario, Keean Johnson and Johnny Knoxville

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry

programme.title: Now You See Me 2 (2016)
programme.desc: A gang of magicians-turned-criminals is reunited for a comeback performance by a ruthless technology magnate, whose actual goal is to force the team into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist on his behalf. The illusionists realise their only hope of avoiding the law is to perform one last unprecedented stunt to expose the businessman's illegal activities. Crime thriller sequel, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Daniel Radcliffe and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Stardust (2007)
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star in question is in fact a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen

programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Mann's thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Possessor (2020)
programme.desc: A secret organisation uses brain implants to control people's bodies at will in order to commit assassinations. This leads to Tasya Vos, a skilled corporate agent, to possess a man whose identity threatens to destroy her own. Horror mystery, starring Andrea Riseborough, Christopher Abbott, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Rossif Sutherland and Gabrielle Graham

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell (1995)
programme.desc: A female cyborg police officer and her human partner search for a devious computer hacker, traversing the realms of cyberspace to bring the evildoer to justice. Animated sci-fi thriller, with the voices of Mimi Woods, Richard George, William Frederick and Abe Lasser

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Rayne's mean streak shows its self and Vicky is left red in the face when she takes on the advice from her friends and makes a move on her ex

programme.title: Hollyoaks

The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

The eatery's decline began when one of the pair started embezzling money to fund his prescription drug addiction, and things only got worse when the he was sentenced to four years in prison. With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brother's trust before he can save their business

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: George Sr and Georgie go camping with Meemaw's new boyfriend Dale, but things get complicated when her ex-boyfriend Dr Sturgis tags along. Sheldon and Missy invent a new game

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard inadvertently gives the impression he is attracted to Amy when he accompanies her to a colleague's wedding. Meanwhile, Howard tries to persuade Bernadette they should live with his mother after getting married and suggests a trial run of the arrangement over the weekend

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj feels upset about not being in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find a date and introduces him to a girl he can actually talk to. They hit it off, but when it becomes apparent he has been buying her expensive gifts, his friends suspect she is only interested in his wealth

programme.title: Modern Family

Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill

programme.desc: Sheldon presses Leonard and Penny to choose a date for their wedding, while he also has to deal with dramatic changes in his own relationship with Amy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny struggles with Leonard's confession that he kissed another woman when he was away on his North Sea research expedition. After driving all the way to Las Vegas, she must now decide whether she wants to go through with the wedding. Back home, Sheldon doesn't know how to act after Amy tells him she wants them to take a relationship break

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard asks Penny out on a date, and they agree to give their relationship another chance. They soon remember why it did not work out in the first place, but end up sleeping together anyway. The 100th episode of the comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny continue testing their rekindled relationship using an innovative system to report discrepancies. Howard and Bernadette begin to worry when Raj starts treating his new phone like a person, while Sheldon and Amy try to achieve internet fame by creating a video podcast about flags

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave is eager to take on a bigger role in the community and prove himself to Calvin, whose reaction makes it clear that their friendship needs more time

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Grover gets into a fight with a bully at school, and Gemma is torn between her role as principal and wanting to protect her son. Calvin encourages Marty to stand up for himself

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell makes a disturbing discovery following an awkward encounter with an old high-school flame, and wonders whether he unknowingly fathered a child in his 'straight' days. Feeling intellectually inferior to Alex, Phil and Claire try to enjoy a subtitled film, while Jay regrets getting on the wrong side of Gloria

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley, Alex and Luke decide to surprise Phil and Claire with breakfast in bed, only to catch them in a compromising position. Mitch and Cameron arrange a play date for Lily, hoping to befriend a fellow parent who also happens to own a swanky new restaurant, and Gloria accidentally sends a nasty e-mail to Claire. Guest starring Rachael Harris (The Hangover)

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon develops a mental block and has difficulty working on a formula, so in a move inspired by Albert Einstein he gets a job at the Cheesecake Factory diner to try to revive his creativity - and despite Penny's objections, proves surprisingly effective in the role. Guest starring Yeardley Smith (The voice of Lisa Simpson)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is invited to visit the Large Hadron Collider in Switzerland and asks Penny to join him as a Valentine's Day treat. However, Sheldon tries to persuade the couple to allow him to take her place

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is driven to distraction when a tune becomes stuck in his head, while Amy and Dave arrange another date and Howard and Raj discover their band has a fan, but tracking him down turns out to be a mistake. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After more than five years of dating, Sheldon and Amy spend their first night together, while Leonard, Howard and Raj must decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket. Plus, Sheldon's Obi-Wan advises him on his difficult relationship decisions. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with recurring guest star Bob Newhart

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

The estranged couple's two children are struggling to save the business from their parents' disputes, and the visiting chef tries to shock the pair into stopping the restaurant from becoming a casualty of their quarrel

programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit

programme.title: Young Sheldon

Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Heir Hunters

Nick and David count the costs and serve up some suspicions at dinner. A long wait for breakfast leaves the guests grumbling, and Tamsyn and Roman find their feedback hard to stomach

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Buxted Inn in Uckfield, East Sussex, run by Nick Bolton and chef David Kirby, and where the focus is on food and wine. Lisa is charmed by the character of the place, but Farid and John think it has a corporate feel. At breakfast, a menu misunderstanding leaves Farid with more than he bargained for

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Crescent Victoria hotel in Margate, Kent, where hosts Farid Al-Faisal and John Dennis aim to treat their guests like royalty. Unfortunately, only one of the pairs feel like princesses, with the rest being less than impressed by the attempt at luxury

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The White Swan is first and Roman and Tamsyn have some cracks to paper over from previous critiques in the week

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers are concerned about a three-month-old Andean bear cub, worrying that its mother's overprotective behaviour may curb its development. The pygmy marmosets have new babies and mum Audrey has to carry her twins everywhere she goes to ensure their safety, while young elephant Nandita is desperate to make friends with babies Aayu and Indali, but her boisterous behaviour is proving too much for them - can she learn the maternal skills she needs to win them round and persuade them to go swimming with her?

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following efforts to match dogs with new owners. Nine-year-old Rohan meets Patterdale terrier puppy Friday, but there are concerns that the hound may be just a bit too enthusiastic for the youngster. Rocco the Jack Russell has been struggling to find a home, though his bouncy exuberance and love of a good face lick means he could be the perfect match for Zach, who is looking for a dog not fazed by his Tourette's. programme.title: Grand Designs

The couple decapitate the building and balance a new floating timber box on top to create five bedrooms, spending as little as possible on plumbing, electrics and insulation, but stress levels spiral when neighbours grumble at the ultra-modern creation

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden

The house they're searching for was key to Bognor's transformation in the 18th century from a sleepy fishing village to a premier holiday spot for wealthy Georgians and the aristocracy. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole restores a petrol pump and turns a hubcap into a clock, and Simon O'Brien repurposes a copper immersion heater into a stylish wash basin

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: It's mating season for Chester Zoo's onagers and after two years living alone, male Holmes is released into the female paddock, where he chases down every female in sight. Galapagos tortoise Charlie is losing weight and keepers believe that it's down to bullying from her older sister, so they decide to step in with an innovative system to try and alleviate the problem

The shocked parents pressure the police for answers, but the trail and motivation become increasingly complicated. Crime drama, starring Sara Forestier, Pierre Rochefort and Bruno Dreyfurst. programme.desc: Jasmine Harman goes house-hunting in the beautiful white-washed villages of inland Malaga with Martin and Louise from Staffordshire. With their five children now grown up and their work lives behind them, the couple are looking for their dream holiday home where they can spend many months of the year enjoying the sunshine. They have a budget of £105,000 and would love a traditional Spanish townhouse with views

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Roni and Malcolm from Exeter are searching for their dream holiday home, south of Granada in southern Spain. With a budget of £150,000, Laura Hamilton sets out to find their perfect property

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Neil and Julie from south Wales seek their dream holiday home near Almunecar on Spain's Costa Tropical. After Neil suffered a serious injury earlier in the year, the couple realised that time is precious and now want to find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. Danni Menzies uses all her property expertise to find the ideal property on a budget of £63,000

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The five remaining teams throw their experience out the window when they make 24 identical re-imagined tarts. In the second challenge, the teams create a pièce montée featuring 160 individual choux buns with a 'Mad Science' theme

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition starts at the Mevagissey Bay Hotel in Cornwall, where owners John and Elleke Ross hope that the stunning sea views will live up to their premium price tag. Guests Sarah and Jay savour the sights, while Catherine and Andrew are dazzled by the decking but puzzled by a mysterious gap around their door. During the afternoon fishing trip, John is angling to outdo solo contestant Sarah, but her take on the facilities leaves the hosts all at sea. In the morning, Catherine and Andrew get a rude awakening, and the breakfast pre-order system gives the other guests food for thought

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week takes place at Glebe House Cottages in Devon, which is owned by Jay and Sarah Brewer

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Dukes in Heath and Reach, Bedfordshire, and while owner Sarah Smith impresses the guests at dinner, the pressure gets to her at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid, while also settling some scores

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first in a week of parties in Newcastle is hosted by mother and workaholic Clare, who aims to impress her guests with an Indian-themed menu of spicy pakoras and lamb curry in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedy promoter David hosts the second night in Newcastle, where he aims to impress his guests with a fine-dining menu featuring caviar, scallops, beef fillet and oysters, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize. However, some of the guests have reservations about the host, meaning he has his work cut out for him

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third night in Newcastle sees sophisticated marketing consultant Liz trying to impress her guests with a fancy French-themed menu. However, she spends most of her time trying to keep the peace as outspoken comedy promoter David annoys club singer John and rubs mum-of-three Clare up the wrong way with his snobbish views

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Club singer John hopes that a menu inspired by his travels around the world will help him win the £1,000 prize as he hosts the fourth night in Newcastle. However, further rifts appear in the group when Vicky wants to discuss Geordie icons

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the night of the final dinner party in Newcastle and the turn of hotel administrator Vicky to entertain her guests. However, there is tension in the air and the spiritual host is challenged to keep the peace when John lets David know exactly what he thinks of him. The theme of negativity continues as mum-of-three Claire and Liz both take the comedy promoter to task over his questionable sense of humour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team attempt to uncover a magnificent seaside villa with a royal connection and find out how West Sussex town Bognor Regis spearheaded the good old British staycation. The house they're searching for was key to Bognor's transformation in the 18th century from a sleepy fishing village to a premier holiday spot for wealthy Georgians and the aristocracy. To find this luxury Regency villa, the team has to excavate a school playing field

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Seventy-year-old Jenny is brought in with a suspected stroke, and doctors must confirm the diagnosis and decide whether she is still in time to receive life-changing treatment. Her husband Roy shares the difficult experiences they've faced together and describes Jenny as the rock of the family. Ronnie has come into St George's with severe lower back pain. Doctors assess whether the 29-year-old's pain is due to his kidney stones or something more serious. Ronnie is accompanied by his girlfriend Anneline, who reflects on the similarities between Ronnie and her late father

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives at a milestone on his American journey as he reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. Beginning in Wilmington, North Carolina, he uncovers the history of gunpowder production in Delaware, before heading to Baltimore, where he discovers how the first American steam engine owed a lot to British technology. On the city's east coast, Michael visits the star-shaped Fort McHenry, and learns how the Star-Spangled Banner national anthem was born

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Continuing his trek from Philadelphia to Jamestown, Michael Portillo arrives in the nation's capital, Washington, DC, centre of political power in the world's most powerful country. Steered by his Appleton's Guide of 1879, he admires its fine public buildings, including the largest library in the world, and discovers how the capital was built from scratch after a political compromise between north and south. After this, he travels on to Mount Vernon, exploring a former slave market and visiting an archaeological dig along the way

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Manassas, Virginia, scene of two crucial battles during the American Civil War. In Fredericksburg, he tries bottling bourbon corn whiskey and learns how it became the nation's spirit. In Richmond, the ex-politician enjoys a tour of the Virginia state Capitol building, where he hears of the dilemma faced by one of its most famous sons, General Robert E Lee, before donning his dancing shoes for a Cotillion ball. Michael ends his journey in Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in North America

programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. programme.desc: Documentary exploring the 2012 murder of British computer engineer Saad Al-Hilli, his dentist wife Ikbal, and her mother Suhaila in the woods near Lake Annecy, a case that has gone unsolved for 10 years. Caught up in a media whirlwind, Saad's brother Zaid was eventually arrested under suspicion of conspiracy to murder and accused of organising the killings of his brother and family over an inheritance dispute, but was cleared and released. Telling the full story for the first time, Zaid is joined by former French prosecutor Eric Maillaud, retired British senior investigating officer Mark Preston, and journalist Tom Parry

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: The conclusion of the crime documentary asks why so much attention was focused on prime suspect Zaid Al-Hilli, who was eventually released without charge. The trail appears to lead to a friend of Sofia's, another scientist who worked for Russia and who may have succumbed to professional jealousy. However, when she too is found dead, the team discovers the hallmarks of Sergei Mishnev, the terrorist who nearly killed Gibbs. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV is helping to bring criminals using weapons to justice. A CCTV operator's instincts lead him to keep an eye on a man acting suspiciously on a train station platform and who then takes a knife out of his pocket and threatens a woman coming towards him. There is also footage of a raid on a west London jewellery shop, with the gang spraying bleach in the eyes of security guards and smashing down the doors with pickaxes while the terrified staff cower inside

There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson realises Matthew is in love with Amelia and manipulatively tells him that he must continue his travels in America in order to win her love, while Bucket continues his investigation by turning his sights on Mr Barbary, who was seen with Marley on Christmas Eve. Elsewhere, Bill tries to take Nancy away from her work as a prostitute, but fails to meet Fagin's lofty price demands, and Mrs Gamp tells Silas a hair-raising story to persuade him not to live alone. Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens, starring Stephen Rea, Adrian Rawlins and Joseph Quinn

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William has his hands full at work when he is hired by a group of bikers to organise the perfect funeral for their friend, but at home he has wedding bells ringing in his ears as he plans a romantic evening with Mary. Rick and Molly undergo a dramatic transformation for a ballroom dancing competition and Terence ends up in hospital after a run-in with a rival gang of graffiti artists. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Cheryl Campbell, Michael Begley and Dominick Baron

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: The Intelligence Men (1965)
programme.desc: A coffee shop employee has a chance encounter with a spy. When he tells the story to a customer who works in the MI5 offices, the duo are recruited to investigate a secret organisation and discover a plot to assassinate a Russian ballerina. Comedy, starring Morecambe and Wise, with William Franklyn, April Olrich, Richard Vernon and Warren Mitchell

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The energetic chef demonstrates how to create party food with a difference. A trip to the delicatessen counter at Harvey Nichols inspires many recipes including Parisian mustard sausage rolls, chicken tikka wrap, and prawn pizzinis, topped off with raspberry and white chocolate muffins for dessert

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton tours Outer Orkney, beginning at North Ronaldsay, which may be the most northerly of the Orkneys but turns out to be surprisingly easy to get to. Paul then hops across to Papa Stronsay, which is now populated by an order of monks who have chosen to make this isolated island their home, and ends on the island of Stroma in the Pentland Firth, a previously inhabited island that was abandoned in the 1950s. One of the last people to live there joins Paul to recall when it was still a thriving community

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits the islands of Coll and Tiree, which though just a few miles apart could not be more different. On Coll, he meets Nicolas Maclean Bristol, owner of Breachacha Castle, who can trace his ancestors on the island back to the 14th century. Tiree is one of the stormiest places in Europe, but is also one of the best places in Britain to surf and practise the relatively new sport of sand yachting, the racing of go-carts with a sail along the beach

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In mid-Wales, Kate and sheepdog Teg have a taste of stone-age life mucking in with a farmer and an archaeologist who are building a medieval-type settlement. Next, they explore the potential death traps of historical legacies at an old lead mine, where the South and Mid Wales Cave Rescue Team practise their skills using Teg as the damsel in distress. Kate also learns about the plight of Welsh mountain ponies, whose numbers have dropped dramatically, and discovers whether her legs are built for mountain biking

programme.title: Buster (1988)
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about the life of Buster Edwards, a member of the gang responsible for the Great Train Robbery. Going on the run after the notorious heist, he flees to Mexico with his family. However, his homesick wife struggles to adapt to her new life, leaving the outlaw with a difficult choice. Starring Phil Collins, Julie Walters, Sheila Hancock, Larry Lamb and Ralph Brown

programme.title: Break (2020)
programme.desc: A petty criminal seeks sanctuary from his out-of-control life in a snooker hall, where a former champion notes his natural skill for the game. He offers him the chance to turn his life around by turning pro - but doing so will mean cutting himself off from his friends. Crime drama, starring Sam Gittins, David Yip and Rutger Hauer, in his final screen role

programme.title: Overlord (1975)
programme.desc: A recruit is called up for service during the Second World War. He undergoes training and gets his first experience of battle, ultimately taking part in the D-Day landings. Drama, starring Brian Stirner, Davyd Harries and Nicholas Ball

programme.desc: Terence's absence is proving difficult for Mary, who decides to visit him at his dad's in Brighton. However, her trip is cut short after Rick phones to tell her Molly's condition has worsened and she has to rush back to be with her in London. Meanwhile, William helps a young boy organise a memorial for his father, but his grandmother refuses to believe he is dead. Drama, starring Julie Graham, Cheryl Campbell and Martin Clunes

programme.desc: Two business partners and their wives take a trip in a cabin cruiser up a river. programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson is officially courting Miss Havisham and, in order to seem a more credible suitor, he demands money from Arthur, who is forced to sell personal family items to obtain the money. Elsewhere, Honoria is determined to solve her father's debt problems and avoid an arranged marriage with Sir Leicester, while the Bumbles entertain Mr Gradgrind, and the Cratchits worry about Tiny Tim. Starring Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Homelessness is on the rise in the UK, but nobody knows how many pregnant women face the possibility of having their baby without a home to go back to. This programme explores the issue of expectant mothers who find themselves with no place to call home, and conducts a survey of midwives in collaboration with the Royal College of Midwives to try to get a sense of the scale of the problem. Ninety-five per cent of the midwives asked strongly felt that homelessness puts the health of the women and their unborn babies at risk. The report follows three women - two of whom are heavily pregnant - experiencing evictions, overcrowding and the reality of living in temporary accommodation for years on end

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: As Prime Minister Theresa May declares that austerity is over, the programme reveals the growing number of parents now using baby banks to provide their young children with nappies, clothes, toys and cots, with the vast majority having been set up since the austerity programme began. For the first time, Dispatches has surveyed these baby banks, to get a sense of who they're serving and the services they're providing and meeting working parents who can't afford the most basic essentials and have to rely on baby banks to provide for their children

programme.desc: The Genesis Scottish Open. Further live coverage of day one from the Renaissance Club in North Berwick, where Xander Schauffele was victorious last year. Other American winners include Grayson Murray, Troy Merritt and Jim Herman
